intro: Eutrema alpestre, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, characteristic of the Brassicaceae family. Eutrema alpestre is often found in meadows and slopes at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
